member.name: BMFORMAT
member.summary: The values of the BMFORMAT enumerated type are used by several WCS functions to indicate the format that particular bitmaps are in.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_x555RGB
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. RGB color space. 5 bits per channel. The most significant bit is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_x555XYZ
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. CIE device-independent XYZ color space. 5 bits per channel. The most significant bit is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_x555Yxy
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. Yxy color space. 5 bits per channel. The most significant bit is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_x555Lab
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. L*a*b color space. 5 bits per channel. The most significant bit is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_x555G3CH
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. G3CH color space. 5 bits per channel. The most significant bit is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_RGBTRIPLETS
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel colors, such as Red,Green,Blue, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel colors, such as gray, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_BGRTRIPLETS
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel colors, such as Red,Green,Blue, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel colors, such as gray, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.

summary.para: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel, X, Y and Z values, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel gray scale, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.
summary.blockquote:
[!Note]
The function does not support as an input.

summary.para: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel, Y, x and y values, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel gray scale, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.
summary.blockquote:
[!Note]
The function does not support as an input.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_LabTRIPLETS
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel, L, a and b values, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel gray scale, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_G3CHTRIPLETS
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel maximum. For three channel values, the total size is 24 bits per pixel. For single channel gray scale, the total size is 8 bits per pixel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_5CHANNEL
member.summary: 40 bits per pixel. 8 bits apiece are used for each channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_6CHANNEL
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. 8 bits apiece are used for each channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_7CHANNEL
member.summary: 56 bits per pixel. 8 bits apiece are used for each channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_8CHANNEL
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel. 8 bits apiece are used for each channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_GRAY
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Only the 8 bit gray-scale value is used.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_xRGBQUADS
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 8 bits are used for each color channel. The most significant byte is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_xBGRQUADS
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 8 bits are used for each color channel. The most significant byte is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_xG3CHQUADS
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 8 bits are used for each color channel. The most significant byte is ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_KYMCQUADS
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 8 bits are used for each color channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_CMYKQUADS
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 8 bits are used for each color channel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_10b_RGB
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 2 most significant bits are ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_10b_XYZ
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 2 most significant bits are ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_10b_Yxy
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 2 most significant bits are ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_10b_Lab
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 2 most significant bits are ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_10b_G3CH
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 2 most significant bits are ignored.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_NAMED_INDEX
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Named color indices. Index numbering begins at 1.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_RGB
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. Each channel uses 16 bits.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_XYZ
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. Each channel uses 16 bits.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_Yxy
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. Each channel uses 16 bits.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_Lab
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. Each channel uses 16 bits.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_G3CH
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel. Each channel uses 16 bits.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_16b_GRAY
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_565RGB
member.summary: 16 bits per pixel. 5 bits are used for red, 6 for green, and 5 for blue.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_32b_scRGB
member.summary: 96 bits per pixel, 32 bit per channel IEEE floating point.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_32b_scARGB
member.summary: 128 bits per pixel, 32 bit per channel IEEE floating point.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_S2DOT13FIXED_scRGB
member.summary: 48 bits per pixel, Fixed point integer ranging from -4 to +4 with a sign bit and 2 bit exponent and 13 bit mantissa.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_S2DOT13FIXED_scARGB
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel, Fixed point integer ranging from -4 to +4 with a sign bit and 2 bit exponent and 13 bit mantissa.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_R10G10B10A2
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The two most significant bits are alpha.

summary.para: 32 bits per pixel. 10 bits are used for each color channel. The 10 bits of each color channel are 2.8 fixed point with a -0.75 bias, giving a range of [-0.76 .. 1.25]. This range corresponds to [-0.5 .. 1.5] in a gamma = 1 space. The two most significant bits are preserved for alpha.
This uses an extended range (XR) sRGB color space. It has the same RGB primaries, white point, and gamma as sRGB.

member.name: BMFORMAT.BM_R16G16B16A16_FLOAT
member.summary: 64 bits per pixel. Each channel is a 16-bit float. The last WORD is alpha.
